channel.title: klipper on freakyDude's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in klipper on freakyDude's Blog

item.title: Use your TouchScreen with Klipper on Sidewinder X2
item.description: Intro If you have been following my recent posts, you know that I switched from Marlin to Klipper firmware on my Artillery Sidewinder X2. If you have done the same, you may be experiencing the same problem as me. I have already received questions from you about how much better the printing results are with Klipper, but that is another topic. Our integrated display is useless! But I found a solution - well - not perfect yet, but more than OK for my main use cases.

item.title: Perfect input shaping - Install the ADXL345 accelerometer on Artillery Sidewinder/Genius Pro
item.description: About installing the ADXL345 accelerometer to calibrate easily input shaping for an Artillery Sidewinder with Klipper firmware.

item.title: Re-enable the Artillery Sidewinder X2 Filament-Runout Sensor
item.description: The post shows you how you can re-enable the stock Artillery Sidewinder X2 filament-runout sensor and configure with the Klipper3D printer firmware afterwards.

item.title: Must-have Mainsail, Klipper and Cura slicer configuration with Artillery Sidewinder X2
item.description: Tutorial about the must-have Mainsail, Klipper and Cura slicer configuration files with Artillery Sidewinder X2.

item.title: Klipper with Artillery Sidewinder X2
item.description: Shows a way to use Klipper as a replacement for the Marlin firmware with your Sidewinder X2
